etymology.description: Early forms depicted as a brush in Shang oracle bone script -> Inverted brush shape mistaken for 又 (yòu, 'hand') in later scripts -> Final form 卒
etymology.interpretation: Originally a pictogram resembling a brush, the character evolved over time due to changes in interpretation of its shape. The inverted depiction led to a misinterpretation that integrated the shape of 又 (yòu, 'hand'), resulting in the character 卒.

examples.chinese: 他努力学习(他努力學習)，终於在仪式上卒(終於在儀式上卒)。
examples.pinyin: Tā nǔlì xuéxí, zhōngyú zài yíshì shàng zú.
examples.english: He worked hard in his studies, and finally graduated at the ceremony.

examples.chinese: 小华准备明年大学卒(小华準備明年大學卒)。
examples.english: Xiaohua is preparing to graduate from university next year.
